page.title: 13Farming in Braydon
page.content: There are 20 working farms in this section almost all of which have dairy herds. 2 also have some beef cattle and 2 have some sheep. One farm grows cereal crops, barley this year 1985, and at least 1 practises organic farming. Most of the grassland is intensivly managed to provide feed for the cattle all year round, in Spring a top dressing of nitrogen fertiliser is applied and the once the grass has grown lush is is cut for silage, often 2 crops are taken each year, then the cattle are let out into the field for the summer. The silage is stored in large enclosed areas and covered with polythene and is fed to the cattle in the Winter when they are kept inside. Hay is also harvested before the cattle are turned out into the fields.
